sentence.Network_en: Fortune reigns in gifts of the would , not in lineament of Nature.
sentence.Network_cn: 命运之神是人世间恩惠的主宰, 不能支配自然的相貌.

sentence.Network_en: The young girl had regular and delicate lineament.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个年轻姑娘的容貌长得端正而且秀丽.

sentence.Network_en: The lineament of the criminal has been found.
sentence.Network_cn: 罪犯的特征已经找到了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin lineamentum, from lineare 'make straight', from linea 'a line' (see line)

means.word_mean: 1. a characteristic property that defines the apparent individual nature of something;

sentences.sentence: "each town has a quality all its own"

means.word_mean: 2. the characteristic parts of a person's face: eyes and nose and mouth and chin;

sentences.sentence: "an expression of pleasure crossed his features"
